metadata.title: Why Is the Mutual Capacitance Method More Water Resistant?

sections.content:
Question:
Why is the mutual capacity method more water resistant?
Answer:
In the mutual capacitance method, the decrease in capacitance between electrodes is detected when a finger touches the panel, and it is judged to have been touched. If water drops adhere to the panel, the inter-electrode capacitance increases. Therefore, the water resistance is high because the change in water droplets and the change in touch can be distinguished.
Suitable Products
RX113
RX130
RX231, RX230
